meanings.definition: The ability of an animal to locate objects by emitting sound waves and interpreting the echoes.
meanings.sent1: Bats use echolocation to find insects in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Dolphins rely on echolocation to navigate underwater.
meanings.sent3: The bat's echolocation skills were so good, it found the juiciest bugs in town!
meanings.sent4: Her echolocation was like a sonar system, pinpointing every obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's echolocation powers allowed him to see through walls and detect danger.

meanings.definition: The process of using reflected sound waves to determine the location of objects.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study echolocation to understand how bats perceive their surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The submarine uses echolocation to avoid underwater obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The echolocation experiment went haywire when the sound waves bounced off a rubber duck!
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, her echolocation was a guiding light, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The echolocation of the bat was so precise, it could map out a room without seeing it.
